sub_title: Strategic Design, Insight and Foresight | DCODE Network | Queering AI
summary:
Grace is a designer, artist, and researcher queering AI. Their practice combines theoretical inquiry with experimentation, spanning performance, facilitation, co-design and futuring—often through play. 

At Deloitte Digital in Australia and the Netherlands, they supported leaders in government and industry to navigate change and improve their services, products, and experiences by facilitating foresightful approach to co-design, research and strategy. Currently pursuing a Marie-Curie PhD fellowship through the DCODE Network, Grace's research centres on cultural and political dimensions of AI, advocating for queer orientations in the responsable design and use of predictive systems.

Grace is a core member of Becoming Studio, a design futures and research studio based out of Barcelona. Her work has been featured at Porto Design Biennale, Telefonica Foundation Madrid, PRIMER New York, the World Futures Congress in Mexico City and TEDx. In addition, they regularly delivers guest lectures and workshops, most recently presenting her paper 'Mutant in the Mirror: Queer Becomings with AI' at the Design Research Society Global Conference in Bilbao. With 10+ years of experience, Grace has been at the forefront of applied futuring—facilitating integration processes, mentoring multidisciplinary teams, and driving tangible change in design, research and innovation.

awards.title: Marc Jacobs Sunshine - Gold winner
awards.description:
Entry Title: Marc Jacobs Sunshine
Entry Category: 18 - Open
Entrant Company Name: OSS Digital

Software used: Auto Cad, Google Sketchup, 123D Make, Maker ware (3D print) , Illustrator, Indesign

Description: 

Marc Jacobs Sunshine was conceptualised in a fanciful and playful way. We created a wonderland experience for the shoppers travelling through the airport. Inclusion of interactive elements such as; the spinning flower garden and a leather-upholstered love seat was key to maximising interaction with the shopper.

The “Love Seat” generated a participatory environment through low-tech fixtures that encouraged users, in particular children to play the spinning flowers.

The layout of the space allowed shoppers to see a clear path from the main retail space to the Sunshines shop. This was achieved through creating a lighting path, which highlighted fixtures stocking the product and acted as a gateway to the point of sale. From the inception phase the design took into account ease of entry and erection by consulting with the assembly team early on.

At the end of that 3 month period the sales figures where 51% up on 2012 which is way above market trend.

authors.headline: Strategic Design, Insight and Foresight | DCODE Network | Queering AI
Strategic Design, Insight and Foresight | DCODE Network | Queering AI

profile_positions.description:
As a part of the DCODE Network, my PhD research is aimed at rethinking design, creating new pathways to the future. Under the umbrella of 'Trusted Interactions,' my research explored AI-powered Digital Twins, as an instance of predictive systems. Investigating ways design can address potential power imbalances between people and predictive, decentralized systems in shaping futures. 

This project has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Skłodowska-Curie grant agreement No 955990.
profile_positions.title: PHD Fellow

profile_positions.description: Co-creating sustainable futures that are good for people, business and society; at speed and scale.  As the capability lead of 'Research and Insights within Deloitte Digital Netherlands, I delivered quality foresightful insights to our client's strategy, innovation and transformation initiatives. While internally strengthening the teams' capability in utilising mixed methods within user research, co-design and sense-making. We did this by converging design research, the 'understanding of people and their relationship with things, with futures research, the 'anticipation of and response to change in the world.'
profile_positions.title: Research and Insights Capability Lead

profile_positions.description: My mandate within Deloitte Digital Australia was to support our clients focus their business efforts on addressing complex problems that work towards sustainable transformations. Making change real by shaping the future as it emerges. Over several years I established a nationwide capability and offering centred on ‘futuring,’ designed to help the people and organisations we work with better navigate change and explore possible futures by blending strategic foresight with strategic design and Research through Design practices that create shared understanding and wiser choices from a deeper place of knowing.
profile_positions.title: Manager Strategic Design and Futures Research

profile_positions.description:
I moved to Deloitte Digital through the acquisition of Mashup, an emerging strategic design consulting studio built on crafting thoughtful spatial, place-based experiences. My role in this transition was to integrate our ways of working, tools and methods that blended spatial design, place-making, and service design with the strategic rigour and digital transformation capabilities of Deloitte Digital. 

Central to my role was driving client engagement in place-based experience design, design futuring, experimentation and participatory design research, working towards strategic and transformational initiatives across contexts from retail to transport and mobility infrastructure.
profile_positions.title: Senior Strategic Designer

profile_positions.description: Tutor and Guest Lecturer. This subject explores the design of possible, probable and plausible futures by examining the social, cultural and ethical implications of design and human-technology relations. Students work in groups to visualise future scenarios, then individually to make speculative prototypes. By critically engaging with the world around them, conducting primary research and designing, students gain an understanding of a range of topics including climate change, artificial intelligence, digital democracies and online communities.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description: My role within Today has been to unlock the potential for the collaborative futuring within service design by embedding methods and tools of foresight into our design research and innovation practice. My aim at Today is to use play as a performative intervention in every project to facilitate collective problem solving and visioning for transformational or transition impact. Ultimately, through my role, I hope to redefine how play is used in design as an instrument to reimagine and create more sustainable, fairer and economically resilient futures.
profile_positions.title: Service Design Lead

profile_positions.description: Community driven experiential learning in STEM. The future of urbanity is about process, sharing, confronting and re-directing our economic narrative towards community activation. I co-founded Three Farm on the basis of the 'Maker Movement,' as a platform for social learning experiences in the design of emerging technologies (i.e., 3D printing), rooted in values of decentralised and democratised knowledge production. We achieve this through delivering tailored, industry-specific professional development workshops and youth programs that grounded participatory learnings in design and futures thinking.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Mash Up™ is a specialist consultancy partnering with clients to deliver Connected Experience™ across physical, digital and brand. 

Connected Experience™ is the retailer’s most powerful way to make sense of the complexity that is today’s path to purchase. It seamlessly links up and integrates all touchpoints. It connects brands with their customers to form lasting relationships.

We make sense of a changing world and changing customer expectations. We are the customer champion and make sure their voice is heard in the business conversation. We help retailers define who their audiences are, map an end-to-end journey that meets customer needs, and design across all touchpoints to create powerful experiences that differentiate businesses and deliver bottom-line results.

We are currently partnering with a number of retailers, service providers and agencies to assist them in defining who their customers are and what are their customer’s needs, to audit their product, social, digital, store and brand touchpoints, to identify where the gaps are between need and delivery, and to create solutions that deliver a better experience for customers. 

We are inter-disciplinary and are focused on the experience rather than the channel. As channel agnostics, we can provide solutions for clients, or partner with peer agencies to deliver holistic solutions.
profile_positions.title: Customer Experience Designer & Creative Strategist

profile_positions.description:
OSS Digital is a Experiential Design and fabrication hub. We are driven by consideration of the moments of engagement, or touch points, between people and brands, and the ideas, emotions, and memories that these moments create. 

The appropriation of lighting, sound, touch, IT and fun won us 2 industry awards in 2013.
http://www.ossdigital.com/testimonials

By partnering with you, our goal is to raise your brand's turnover by providing shoppers with irresistible experiences, and superior brand messaging. Understanding consumer trends allows us to keep up to date with the latest, most innovative ideas, which OSS can then develop into leading designs for your promotion. Due to OSS Digital's in-house manufacturing capabilities, our designers have the knowledge and ability to provide concepts including, but not exclusive to, the requirements of print, lighting, sound, video and interactive activities that can be applied to newly built or existing POS and POP up sites.

Scope of work: Concept design and documentation for temporary branded environments, research and project development for new technologies in fabrication and sustainable materials. My work focus is in experiential retail design, exhibition design and human centred design.
profile_positions.title: Interior Designer, Spatial Experience Design Lead

profile_positions.description: Interior Designer - Junior roll: Scope of work was primarily to assist design development on lage commercial scale projects such as Quantas lounges, Macquarie bank, Electrolux as well as smaler scale hospitality projects such as Bar 100 Gorge street.
profile_positions.title: Intern - Junior
